info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 3:25PM EDT until May 04 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Cabarrus County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Iredell County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southwestern Rowan County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 325 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southeast of Statesville, or 5 miles east of Troutman, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Kannapolis, West Concord, Mooresville, China Grove, Landis, Enochville, Troutman, Cleveland, Faith and Coddle Creek Reservoir. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
